Ok, long comment, part 1:

So I refactored the Channelz class hierarchy, and I think what I landed on is clean, though it is not what we discussed yesterday. Here it is in a diagram:

![untitled presentation 1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6148140/43029423-1903fc9e-8c3b-11e8-8f19-2997c7cf8501.png)

`CallCountingAndTracingNode` is a very helpful middle node to have, since Channels, Subchannels, and Servers all need to support channel trace, and call counting. By putting that functionality there, then all the children inherit `RecordCall{Started|Succeeded|Failed}` as well as the `trace()` accessor to add Trace Events.

`CallCountingAndTracingNode` also supports two rendering helpers; `PopulateTrace` and `PopulateCallData` these are non virtual. It allows children to easily render those parts.

All of the children must support `RenderJson`. This is the only thing accessed from `ChannelRegistry` and tests.

`ClientChannelNode` needs to inherit from `ChannelNode` since we store it in channel.cc, which cannot have knowledge of `ClientChannelNode`.

Long comment, part 2:

I had some trouble figuring out how to correctly increment the subchannel's `Calls{Succeeded}|Failed}` counters. We only actually know that status from `post_batch_completion` in call.cc

My solution was to have the subchannel attach itself to the call, then the call increments the subchannels counters in `post_batch_completion`. This isn't perfect, but I did not see a better way around that didn't involve a lot more extra work in the hotpath (like injecting a callback and parsing status earlier)

Let me know if you have better ideas.
